meanings.definition: To represent or depict in a particular way.
meanings.sent1: She was rendering a beautiful painting of the sunset.
meanings.sent2: The artist was rendering the landscape with great attention to detail.
meanings.sent3: The children were rendering their favorite cartoon characters in crayon.
meanings.sent4: Her words were rendering a vivid image of the bustling city streets.
meanings.sent5: The photographer was rendering the natural beauty of the forest in stunning photographs.

meanings.definition: The action of melting down animal fat to produce lard.
meanings.sent1: The chef used rendering to make the perfect lard for the pie crust.
meanings.sent2: The rendering process resulted in a jar of high-quality lard.
meanings.sent3: The kitchen was filled with the scent of rendering fat for the cooking.
meanings.sent4: The rendering of the fat created a smooth and creamy texture for the dish.
meanings.sent5: The old recipe called for rendering the fat slowly over low heat.

meanings.definition: A version or interpretation of a piece of music or text.

meanings.sent2: His rendering of the Shakespearean sonnet was both powerful and moving.
